articles.description: England face Nigeria in the last 16 of the Women's World Cup with momentum on their side but must avoid complacency, says manager Sarina Wiegman.
articles.title: England guard against complacency as Nigeria await

articles.description: Arsenal's Community Shield win against Manchester City has lifted the "mental block" the Gunners had when facing the Premier League champions.
articles.title: 'Mental block is gone' – Arsenal enjoy 'statement' win

articles.description: Retiring USA forward Megan Rapinoe exits the Women's World Cup stage in tears as the defending champions are knocked out on penalties.
articles.title: 'Sick joke' - Rapinoe leaves centre stage in tears

articles.description: Watch highlights as England are beaten by Australia 45-61 in their first ever Netball World Cup final.
articles.title: England lose to Australia in first World Cup final

articles.description: England head coach Jess Thirlby says her side are "gutted" but "grateful" for a silver medal after their Netball World Cup final loss to Australia - but what next?
articles.title: What next for ‘gutted' but 'grateful’ England?

articles.description: Watch the best plays from day six of The Hundred 2023, featuring Welsh Fire's Haris Rauf, Northern Supercharger's Linsey Smith and Paige Scholfield of the Oval Invincibles.
articles.title: Rauf has lungs of steel - Hundred plays of the day

articles.description: Bryson DeChambeau produces one of the most remarkable rounds in the history of golf on Sunday, shooting 58 to win the LIV Golf Greenbrier title.
articles.title: DeChambeau hits historic 58 in LIV Golf victory

articles.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says "the big brains" never consulted people in the game with the new injury-time rules.
articles.title: Injury-time big brains never consulted us - Guardiola

articles.description: Kylian Mbappe will not train with the Paris St-Germain first team when they step up preparations on Monday for the start of the Ligue 1 season.
articles.title: Mbappe will not train with PSG first-team squad

articles.description: Arsenal gave their hopes of beating Manchester City to the Premier League title a psychological boost as they defeated Pep Guardiola's side on penalties to win the Community Shield.
articles.title: Arsenal beat Man City in Community Shield shootout
